title: Links for February 2013
summary:
Key ideas:

- Data storage in DNA and its implications for genetic error correction
- Male German soldiers growing left (but not right) breasts
- Growth in government spending mostly due to entitlement programs, particularly healthcare
- Text accelerator program that flashes words upon the screen at a constant rate to force speed reading
- Attempt to create the first Neanderthal baby in 30,000 years
- School shooting and bullying based on hair color
- Going to prison increases future earnings in the crime industry by $11,000
- Penicillin, rather than birth control, caused the age of free love by eliminating the fear of syphilis
- Link between violent video game sales numbers and crime rate numbers find a significant decrease in crime when video game sales go up
- Dogs have theory of mind and are more likely to steal food in the dark
- Scientists looking at scans of brain structure can now determine political beliefs with 83% accuracy

Key learnings:

- DNA storage has practical applications in genetic error correction
- Antiandrogen drugs may lead to breast growth in men
- Growth in government spending is driven by entitlement programs, particularly healthcare
- Speed reading can be trained and improved
- The attempt to create a Neanderthal baby has ethical concerns
- Bullying based on hair color can have devastating consequences
- Incarceration often leads to criminal employment opportunities
- Penicillin had a significant impact on sexual freedom in the 20th century
- Violent video games may actually decrease crime
- Dogs are capable of deception
- Brain structure may play a role in political beliefs

Key questions:

- What are the potential implications of practical DNA synthesis?
- Why are antiandrogen drugs leading to breast growth in men?
- What other factors may contribute to government spending growth?
- Is speed reading an effective technique for improving reading skills?
- What are the ethical concerns surrounding the attempt to create a Neanderthal baby?
- How can hair color-based bullying be addressed?
- How does incarceration impact criminal opportunities?
- What other factors beyond penicillin contributed to the age of sexual liberation in the 20th century?
- What other unexpected factors may be linked to crime rates?
- What other forms of deception may animals be capable of?
- How much do brain structure and biology influence political beliefs?
